Kilas Balik Munculnya Desakan Penerbitan Perpu KPK
01 Nov 2019, 18:31 by Andita Rahma, Budi Riza
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta -- Presiden Joko Widodo mengatakan belum akan mengeluarkan Peraturan Pemerintah Pengganti Undang-Undang Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi atau Perpu KPK.
Dia beralasan proses uji materi UU KPK hasil revisi masih berlangsung di Mahkamah Konstitusi. Presiden Jokowi pun meminta masyarakat untuk menghargai proses itu.
"Jangan ada, orang yang masih berproses, uji materi kemudian langsung ditimpa dengan sebuah keputusan yang lain. Saya kira kita harus tahu sopan santun dalam bertata-negara," kata Jokowi dalam dialog bersama wartawan di Istana Merdeka, Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019.

Berikut perjalanan Perpu KPK:


1. Revisi UU KPK disahkan pada 17 September 2019

Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat atau DPR mengesahkan RUU KPK pada 17 September 2019 dalam sidang paripurna. Ini melalui pembahasan DPR setelah Presiden Jokowi meneken Surat Presiden terkait Revisi Undang-Undang Nomor 30 Tahun 2002 tentang Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi atau KPK pada awal September lalu. Surpres juga dikirim ke DPR.

2. Kontra dan Aksi Masyarakat

Imbas dari sahnya RUU itu adalah terjadinya aksi protes dan kritik dari publik. Mahasiswa, LSM, dan tokoh nasional menolak UU KPK hasil revisi. Puncak dari protes dan kritik itu adalah ribuan mahasiswa berdemo di depan Gedung DPR-MPR, Senayan, Jakarta Selatan pada 19 September 2019.
Merasa tidak puas, mahasiswa kembali menggelar aksi unjuk rasanya pada 23 September 2019. Aksi serentak ini dilakukan di sejumlah wilayah di Indonesia. Lima mahasiswa tewas saat atau pasca demonstrasi berlangsung karena luka tembak hingga pukulan benda keras.
Mereka adalah Randy, Muhammad Yusuf Kardawi, Bagus Putra Mahendra, Akbar Alamsyah, dan Maulana Suryadi.

3. Mahasiwa Tempuh Jalur Hukum

Selain berdemo, pada 18 September 2019, sebanyak 18 mahasiswa dari sejumlah universitas menggugat UU KPK yang baru disahkan DPR ke Mahkamah Konstitusi.
Kuasa pemohon, Zico Leonard mengatakan ada dua gugatan yang diajukan yakni gugatan formil dan materiil. Pada gugatan formil, para penggugat mempersoalkan proses pembentukan UU yang tidak melibatkan partisipasi masyarakat.
Sementara dalam gugatan materiil, para penggugat mempersoalkan syarat pimpinan KPK yang diatur dalam Pasal 29 UU KPK. Sejumlah syarat di antaranya tidak pernah melakukan perbuatan tercela, memiliki reputasi yang baik, dan melepaskan jabatan struktural atau jabatan lain selama menjadi bagian KPK.

4. Jokowi Pertimbangkan untuk Terbitkan Perpu KPK

Desakan publik agar Presiden Jokowi menerbitkan Perpu KPK semakin kuat. Selain itu, sejumlah tokoh dan cendekiawan turut meminta Jokowi mengambil opsi itu.
Menanggapi saran itu, Jokowi kemudian mengaku akan mempertimbangkan tuntutan dari berbagai pihak, termasuk mahasiswa. Jokowi mengatakan itu setelah menerima masukan dari berbagai pihak.
"Berkaitan UU KPK yang sudah disahkan DPR, banyak sekali masukan yang diberikan kepada kita. Utamanya berupa penerbitan Perpu. Ini akan kita hitung, kalkulasi, kita pertimbangkan," ujar Presiden Jokowi setelah berdiskusi dengan tokoh agama di Istana Negara, pada 26 September 2019.
Namun, hari ini, 1 November 2019, Presiden Jokowi mengatakan belum akan mengeluarkan Perpu KPK.

Flashback of the Emergence of the Urge to Issue KPK Regulation
Nov 01 2019, 18:31 by Andita Rahma, Budi Riza
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - President Joko Widodo has said that he will not issue a Government Regulation in Lieu of Corruption Eradication Commission Act or KPK Perpu.
He reasoned that the review of the KPK Law material review process was still ongoing in the Constitutional Court. President Jokowi also asked the public to respect the process.
"Do not be there, people who are still in the process, testing the material and then immediately overwritten by another decision. I think we must know manners in the state administration," Jokowi said in a dialogue with reporters at the Merdeka Palace, Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019 .

Following the KPK Perpu journey:


1. The revision of the KPK Law was passed on 17 September 2019

The House of Representatives or DPR passed the KPK Bill on 17 September 2019 in a plenary session. This was through a discussion of the DPR after President Jokowi signed a Presidential Letter related to the Revision of Law Number 30 Year 2002 concerning the Corruption Eradication Commission or the Corruption Eradication Commission in early September. Surpres was also sent to the DPR.

2. Community Counter and Action

The impact of the validity of the bill is the occurrence of protests and criticism from the public. Students, NGOs, and national figures reject the revised KPK Law. The climax of the protest and criticism was that thousands of students demonstrated in front of the DPR-MPR Building, Senayan, South Jakarta on September 19, 2019.
Feeling dissatisfied, the students held a demonstration again on September 23, 2019. This simultaneous action was carried out in a number of regions in Indonesia. Five students were killed during or after the demonstration took place because of gunshot wounds to hard objects.
They are Randy, Muhammad Yusuf Kardawi, Bagus Putra Mahendra, Akbar Alamsyah, and Maulana Suryadi.

3. Students take the Legal Path

In addition to the demonstration, on September 18, 2019, 18 students from a number of universities sued the KPK Law which was recently passed by the DPR to the Constitutional Court.
The applicant's attorney, Zico Leonard said there were two lawsuits filed namely formal and material claims. In formal lawsuits, the plaintiffs question the process of establishing a law that does not involve public participation.
While in the material lawsuit, the plaintiffs questioned the requirements of the KPK leadership as regulated in Article 29 of the KPK Law. A number of conditions include never having committed a disgraceful act, having a good reputation, and relinquishing structural positions or other positions while being part of the KPK.

4. Jokowi Consider to Issue KPPU Regulation

Public pressure for President Jokowi to issue a KPK regulation is getting stronger. In addition, a number of prominent figures and intellectuals also asked Jokowi to take that option.
Responding to that suggestion, Jokowi later claimed he would consider the demands of various parties, including students. Jokowi said that after receiving input from various parties.
"Regarding the KPK Law which was passed by the DPR, a lot of input was given to us. The main issue is the issuance of a Perpu. We will calculate it, calculate it, we will consider it," said President Jokowi after discussing with religious leaders at the State Palace, on September 26, 2019.
However, today, November 1, 2019, President Jokowi said he would not issue a KPPU regulation.
